title: Toral subalgebra
summary: In mathematics, a toral subalgebra is a Lie subalgebra of a general linear Lie algebra all of whose elements are semisimple (or diagonalizable over an algebraically closed field).[1] Equivalently, a Lie algebra is toral if it contains no nonzero nilpotent elements.  Over an algebraically closed field, every toral Lie algebra is abelian;[1][2] thus, its elements are simultaneously diagonalizable.
